children.name: Introduction
Analyze and improve your on-time payment performance​

blocks.text: This dashboard provides transparency on how you can optimize your on-time payment performance.  Paying your suppliers on time is crucial to improve your working capital while at the same time not damaging supplier relationships. Whereas early payments without any discount decrease your Days Payable Outstanding unnecessarily - if you paid on time you could have used the money for other investments and/or earned interest in the meantime. Even though you are increasing your Days Payable Outstanding when paying late, this could be risky since you might annoy suppliers you are depending on. The following dashboard helps you to detect root causes for early and late payments and includes recommendations on how to improve your on-time payment performance.
The following use cases are considered in this analysis:
General Overview: Get an overview on your on-time payment performance and understand to which extent early and/or late payments are an issue for your company.

Avoid early payments and increase your Days Payable Outstanding: Paying early without discount does decrease your Days Payable Outstanding. Learn why these might occur and what could be changed along your process to avoid early payments.

Avoid late payments and improve your supplier relationships: Paying suppliers late can damage supplier relationships and thus represents a business risk. Understand the root causes for late payments and how to avoid them moving forward.
Details: In case you would like to drill down to single document level, you may use this view to get further details for each invoice document.
Timeframe
The invoices included in this analysis are selected based on their document date.  Please be aware that only completed cases included to this dashboard.

children.name: MIN case creation date
children.description: The date on which the first invoice was issued based on the document date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MIN("Document date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Last data collection
children.description: Last data collection collected from SAP Signavio Process Insights

dataSource.query: SELECT LAST("Data collection timestamp") FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: MAX case creation date
children.description: The date on which the last invoice was issued based on the document date

dataSource.query:
SELECT MAX("Document date")
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: 01. General Overview
Number of cases
children.description: Total number of invoices that have been created within the reference period

children.name: Early payment rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices cleared early, i.e. more than 3 days before net due date and without cash discount

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Total invoice amount
children.description: Gross invoice amount for all invoices

children.name: General Overview

blocks.text: Analyzing your on-time payment performance helps to understand whether you have improvement potential in this area. On-time payment is defined as clearing on the net due date or 3 days before, or more than 3 days before but with cash discount.

children.name: Percentage of on-time. Late and early payment over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date" ) AS "Clearing date",
    SUM("Amount converted") AS "Amount affected",
	CASE 
	 	WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date"
	THEN 'Late payment'
		WHEN "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		  AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)
	THEN 'Early payment'
	ELSE 'On-time payment'
	END AS "Clearing behaviour"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('month'), NULL

children.name: Clearing behaviour by top 10 company codes by invoice value
children.description: Showing clearing behaviour for the 10 company codes with the biggest invoice value

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount", 
 		"Company code",
		"Clearing behaviour"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Company code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted") AS "Invoice amount", 
         CASE WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date" THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS "Clearing date > Net due date",
		 CASE 
		 	WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date"
		 THEN 'Late payment'
			WHEN "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
			  AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)
		 THEN 'Early payment'
		 ELSE 'On-time payment'
		 END AS "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Company code",
         SUM (SUM("Amount converted")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Company code") as "sum"
         FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
      WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: On-time payment rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices cleared on-time i.e. neither after net due date nor more than 3 days before net due date and without cash discount

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		(SUM("Amount converted") -
		(SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
	    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
			   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
	           +
		 SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
				(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
		))
    	/ 
    	SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "On-time payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Clearing behaviour by top 10 vendors by invoice value
children.description: Showing clearing behaviour for the 10 vendors with the biggest invoice value

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Invoice amount", 
 		"Vendor",
		"Clearing behaviour"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Invoice amount", 
         "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Vendor",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted") AS "Invoice amount", 
         CASE WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date" THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS "Clearing date > Net due date",
		 CASE 
		 	WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date"
		 THEN 'Late payment'
			WHEN "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
			  AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)
		 THEN 'Early payment'
		 ELSE 'On-time payment'
		 END AS "Clearing behaviour", 
         "Vendor",
         SUM (SUM("Amount converted")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Vendor") as "sum"
         FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
ORDER BY 1 DESC

children.name: Prioritizing company codes and vendors for on-time payment performance improvement

blocks.text: Analyzing the breakdown by company code, enables you to understand how organizational units perform in terms of on-time payment performance. It provides information on whether certain company codes struggle with early respectively late payments and thus prioritize them accordingly when it comes to process improvements.

Additionally, it is helpful to understand whether vendors are affected rather by early or late payment or paid on time. For example, if some of your biggest vendors are paid too late this might be a motivation for changing the clearing behavior since you might put your supplier relationship at risk. If you pay your biggest vendors too early, this has a negative impact on your working capital. In case you identify certain company codes/vendors which should be prioritized when it comes to avoiding early/late payments you might want to filter on them in the following analyses.

children.name: On-time payment amount
children.description: Amount of invoices cleared on-time i.e. neither after net due date nor more than 3 days before net due date and without cash discount

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		(SUM("Amount converted") -
		(SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
	    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
			   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
	           +
		 SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
				(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
		)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Percentage of on-time. Late and early payment over time
children.description: Development of on-time payment, late payment and early payment rate over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date" ) AS "Clearing date", 
    "CB Name" AS "KPI Name",
	"KPI" AS "Clearing behaviour"
FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date" ) AS "Clearing date",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
							(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    / SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "KPI",
    'Late payment rate' AS "CB Name"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date" ) AS "Clearing date",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    		(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		    AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "KPI",
    'Early payment rate' AS "CB Name"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date" ) AS "Clearing date",
    (SUM("Amount converted") -
			 (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
	    	 (WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
			   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
	           +
		      SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
				(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
			  ))
    / SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "KPI",
    'On-time payment rate' AS "CB Name"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub1
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('month'), NULL

children.name: Late payment rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices cleared late, i.e. after the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	/ SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Financial impact of early and late payments
children.description: Calculating the impact of early payments by assuming a default interest rate of 4% which could have been gained for the days the invoice was payed too early and penalty interest of 10% for late payments which are more than 7 days late

dataSource.query:
SELECT  (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Net due date" - "Clearing date") FILTER (
		WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)))
        * 0.04 / 365) 
        +
        (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Clearing date" > "Net due date"
		AND "Clearing date" - "Net due date" <= DURATION '7days')
        )
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Clearing date" - "Net due date") FILTER (
        WHERE ("Clearing date" > "Net due date" AND "Clearing date" - "Net due date" <= DURATION '7days')))
		* 0.1 / 365)
		AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Detect issues with early and late payment

blocks.text: Assuming that your on-time payment performance is not ideal, the early and late payment rate can help you to understand to what extent you have an issue with early and/or late payments. Based on that, you can check the additional deep dive analyses for avoiding early and late payments.
Early payments are payments performed up to 3 days before the net due date without cash discount
Late payments are performed after the net due date

The financial impact of early payments is calculated based on the assumed interest (assumption: 4%) you could earn if you had not paid early. The impact of late payments is calculated assuming penalty interest you have to pay.

children.name: Assess clearing behavior over time

blocks.text: In order to detect patterns and/or improvements regarding your on-time payment performance over time, the following analyses provide insights on how your on-time payment performance evolves over time including your rate of early and late payments. This enables you to understand whether there are improvements in your payment behavior over time, whether there are certain peaks in early/late payment behavior etc.

children.name: 02. Avoid early payments
Avoid early payments and increase your Days Payable Outstanding

blocks.text: Early payments without cash discount mean that you unnecessarily provide capital to your vendor which could be spent otherwise - either by making new investments or by earning interest for the respective amount. Early payments can occur in case payment is performed manually or in case payment runs are ran not frequently enough.
Use the following analyses to understand to what extent early payments are an issue for your company and detect potential root causes.

children.name: Early payment rate and amount over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date") AS "Clearing date",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Amount affected"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Top 10 vendors with highest amount of early payments and percentage of early payment

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Percentage", 
 		"Vendor"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Percentage", 
         "Vendor",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Affected amount", 
        	  SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    		  / 
    		  SUM("Amount converted") * 100  as "Percentage", 
         	"Vendor",
         	SUM (SUM("Amount converted")  FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))) OVER (PARTITION BY "Vendor") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 company codes with highest amount of early payments and percentage of early payment

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Percentage", 
 		"Company Code"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Percentage", 
         "Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Affected amount", 
        	  SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    		  / 
    		  SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Percentage", 
         	 "Company Code",
         	 SUM (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    			(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   		AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))) OVER (PARTITION BY "Company Code") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Understand how early invoices are paid

blocks.text: When analyzing early payments, it is crucial to understand how early invoices are paid.

If invoices are paid a couple of days early, the financial impact might not be very big, since the interest to be earned in case the payment would have been made on time is very low. However, if invoices are paid significantly earlier, there is a big financial impact since the period during which interest could have been gained or new investments could have been made is very long.

That's why the analysis on the right separates early payments into buckets so that you can assess how big of an issue your early payments are and what impact they have. Depending on that, you can refine your analysis.

children.name: Early payment rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices paid early, i.e. 3 days before net due date and without cash discount​

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Early payment amount
children.description: Amount of invoices paid early, i.e. 3 days before net due date and without cash discount​

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Average days too early
children.description: Calculates the average of how early early payment are performed by taking into account the difference between the clearing data and three days before the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Net due date" - "Clearing date") AS "AVG days too early"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS
	WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)

children.name: Early payments - Categorization
children.description: Shows how early early payments are performed based on buckets

dataSource.query:
SELECT
   SUM("Amount converted" ) AS "Amount affected",
  CASE
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '0day'
    AND (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) <= DURATION '7day' THEN 'b. 0-7 days'
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '7day'
    AND (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) <= DURATION '14day' THEN 'c. 8-14 days'
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '14day'
    AND (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) <= DURATION '30day' THEN 'd. 15-30 days'
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '30day'
    AND (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) <= DURATION '60day' THEN 'e. 31-60 days'
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '60day'
    AND (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) <= DURATION '90day' THEN 'f. 61-90 days'
    WHEN (
      "Net Due Date" - "Clearing Date"
    ) > DURATION '90day' THEN 'g. >90 days'
    END AS "Clearing Category",
	CASE
    	WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    END AS "Process Variant"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
	 "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
	  AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)
ORDER BY
  2 ASC
 NULLS LAST

children.name: Impact of early payments: Company code/vendor combinations with more than 10 cases affected ordered by early payment rate

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Clearing date" AS "Clearing month",
	"Company code",
	"Vendor",
	"Payment run indicator",
	"# Cases",
	"Invoice amount",
	"Early payment rate",
	"Cases affected",
	"Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date") AS "Clearing date",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Amount converted") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Amount converted" ) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Amount affected",
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate",
	"Company code",
    "Vendor",
    CASE 
	WHEN "Clearing transaction code" IS NULL
	OR "Clearing transaction code" = 'F110' 
    THEN '✅' ELSE '⛔'
	END AS "Payment run indicator"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE "Cases affected" > 10
ORDER BY 7 DESC, 9 DESC

children.name: Financial impact of early payments
children.description: Calculating the impact of early payments by assuming a default interest rate of 4% which could have been gained for the days the invoice was paid too early

dataSource.query:
SELECT  SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Net due date" - "Clearing date") FILTER (
		WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)))
	    * 0.04 / 365 AS "Financial impact"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Prioritizing company codes and vendors to avoid early payments

blocks.text: Company codes which show a high amount of cases with early payments might need special attention. You might want to check to what extent they are using payment runs. In addition, you might want to take a look at vendors who are often paid early. Early payments for specific suppliers might be an indicator for specific agreements with suppliers which might deviate from the payment terms maintained in supplier master data or even compliance issues.

children.name: Detect patterns and potential root causes for early payments

blocks.text: A typical root cause for early payments is that the payment run is either not run at all or not run frequently enough. That's why the following table shows to what extent the payment run is used for company codes and vendors affected by early payments.

In case the payment run is not used at all, this would be a reason for further investigating via which way the items are cleared and why this is the case - for example, due to a specific supplier or a higher amount.

If the payment run is used but there is still an issue with early payments for the respective company code/vendor, the reason might be that the payment run is not run frequently enough. The payment run triggers payment for all items due until the "next posting date" which is a parameter entered when setting up the payment run. The more the next posting date is in the future, the bigger the probability for early payments.

children.name: Analyze how early payments are posted

blocks.text: As mentioned above, the way of how open items are cleared can provide insights regarding why payments are performed early. Except for the payment run, manual clearing transaction codes can be used to clear open items. However, contrary to the payment run, these do not automatically take the net due date into account. That's why it is helpful to understand which transaction codes are used for early payments.

In case transaction codes like FB1K "Clear vendor" are used for clearing and result in early payments, this might indicate that for specific vendors, clearing is triggered early manually - for example due to pressure of suppliers or compliance issues resulting in preferential treatment of the supplier.

If manual transactions like FB05 "Post with clearing" are used for early payments, this could indicate for example pressure by suppliers or missing end user training since the users might not be aware of the logic of the payment run which automatically considers payment conditions.
Please note that the analyses below include early payments performed via manual transactions are considered.

children.name: Payment postings using manual payment transactions by company code and vendor (with >10 cases affected)
children.description: Considering early and manual payments only, vendors and company codes with more than 10 such cases are shown by transaction code

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Company code",
	"Vendor",
	"Transaction used for manual payment",
	"Early payment rate",
	"Cases affected",
	"Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date") AS "Clearing date",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Amount converted") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Amount converted" ) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Amount affected",
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate",
	"Company code",
    "Vendor",
    "Clearing transaction code" AS "Transaction used for manual payment"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE "Cases affected" > 10
AND ("Clearing transaction code" != 'F110')
AND "Early payment rate" > 0
ORDER BY 4 DESC, 6 DESC

children.name: Manual payments by transaction code (with >10 cases affected)
children.description: Considering early payments and manual payments only, the transaction codes are shown for which more than 10 of such cases are posted

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Manual payment run transaction",
    "Amount affected",
	"Early payment rate"

FROM
(
SELECT 
	COUNT(1) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Amount converted" ) FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)) AS "Amount affected",
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
    	(WHERE "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		   AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL))
    / 
    SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Early payment rate",
    "Clearing transaction code" AS "Manual payment run transaction"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE "Cases affected" > 10
	AND ("Clearing transaction code" != 'F110') 
	AND "Early payment rate" > 0
ORDER BY 3 DESC, 2 DESC

children.name: 03. Avoid late payments
Avoid late payments and improve your supplier relationships

blocks.text: From a working capital perspective, late payments might not necessarily be an issue since they increase Days Payable Outstanding. However, paying late does not only prevent you from making use of cash discounts, but it also risks damaging your supplier relationships or even paying penalty interest. In order to ensure your customers receive their goods/services in time, it is essential that you have good relationships with your suppliers and make sure that your suppliers deliver on time. That's why you'd like to avoid paying your suppliers late.

The following analyses allow you to understand to what extent late payments are an issue for your company. In the following, it provides insights into potential root causes for late payments. This is a starting point for you to define how to avoid late payments moving forward.
Please note that the calculation of the financial impact of late payments is calculated based on an assumed penalty interest rate which you'll have to pay to the supplier.

children.name: Late payment rate and amount over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date") AS "Clearing date",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	/ SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
    SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
		(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Top 10 company codes with highest amount of late payments and percentage of late payment

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Late payment rate", 
 		"Company Code"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Late payment rate", 
         "Company Code",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted")  FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
 				AS "Affected amount", 
        	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	    / SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate", 
         	"Company Code",
         	SUM (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Company Code") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Top 10 vendors with highest amount of late payments and percentage of late payment

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "Affected amount",
		"Late payment rate", 
 		"Vendor"
FROM (
       SELECT 
         DENSE_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY "sum" DESC) as "DENSE_RANK",
         "Affected amount", 
         "Late payment rate", 
         "Vendor",
         "sum"
       FROM (
       SELECT SUM("Amount converted")  FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
 				AS "Affected amount", 
        	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	    / SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
         	"Vendor",
         	SUM (SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
		       (WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")) OVER (PARTITION BY "Vendor") as "sum"
       FROM
         THIS_PROCESS
) AS SUB
    ) AS Sub
    WHERE "DENSE_RANK" <=10
	AND "Affected amount" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY 1 DESC
LIMIT 10

children.name: Understand how late vendors are paid

blocks.text: When analyzing late payments, it is crucial to understand how late invoices are paid.

If invoices are paid a couple of days late, the financial impact might not be very big, since vendors might still tolerate it and might not charge any penalty interest. However, if invoices are paid significantly late, there is a big financial impact since you might annoy vendors and pay penalty interest.

That's why the analysis on the right separates late payments into buckets so that you can assess how big of an issue your late payments are and what impact they have. Depending on that, you can refine your analysis.

children.name: Late payments - Categorization
children.description: Shows how early early payments are performed based on buckets

dataSource.query:
SELECT
   SUM("Amount converted" ) AS "Amount affected",
  CASE
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '0day'
    AND (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '7day' THEN 'b. 0-7 days'
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '7day'
    AND (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '14day' THEN 'c. 8-14 days'
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '14day'
    AND (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '30day' THEN 'd. 15-30 days'
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '30day'
    AND (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '60day' THEN 'e. 31-60 days'
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '60day'
    AND (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) <= DURATION '90day' THEN 'f. 61-90 days'
    WHEN (
      "Clearing Date" - "Net Due Date"
    ) > DURATION '90day' THEN 'g. >90 days'
    END AS "Clearing Category",
	CASE
    	WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    END AS "Process Variant"
FROM
  THIS_PROCESS
WHERE
"Clearing date" > "Net due date"
ORDER BY
  2 ASC
 NULLS LAST

children.name: Late payment rate
children.description: Percentage of invoices paid late, i.e. after net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
		SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	/ SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Late payment amount
children.description: Amount of invoices paid late, i.e. after net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
		(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Average days too late
children.description: Calculates the average of how late late payment are performed by taking into account the difference between the clearing date and the net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	AVG("Clearing date" - "Net due date") AS "AVG days too late"
    FROM THIS_PROCESS
	WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date"

children.name: Late payments by root cause category

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--Invoice posted or payment block released after net due date--
SELECT
'Invoice posted or payment block released after net due date' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		--'Posted after net due date'
		WHERE ("Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date")
		--'Late invoice approval via other means'
		OR ("Release date" > "Net due date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL) 
		--'Late invoice verification'
		OR ((SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date")
		--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
		OR ((SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date")
		)
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL

--Disadvantageous payment conditions--
SELECT
'Disadvantageous payment conditions' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		--'Immediate payment terms'
		WHERE ("Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0)
			--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
	    OR ("Cash discount days 1") < 
    	  ("PO payment term cash discount days 1") OR 
          ("Cash discount days 2") < 
    	  ("PO payment term cash discount days 2") OR 
          ("Net payment terms period") <
          ("PO payment term Net payment terms period")
		--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
		OR ("PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL
		)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL 
--'High manual effort'--
SELECT 
	 'High manual effort' AS "RCA category"
     , "Clearing date"
     , "Net due date"
     , "Process Flow"
     ,  SUM("Amount Converted") AS "Amount Affected"
     FROM (SELECT vendor
		   , case_id
           , "Clearing date"
           , "Net due date"
           , "Process Flow"
           , "Amount Converted"
		   ,"Clearing transaction code"
		   ,(SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  			AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) AS changes
           , COUNT(1) OVER (PARTITION BY vendor) AS total_cases_per_vendor
           , COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') OVER (PARTITION BY vendor) AS automated_cases_per_vendor
FROM THIS_PROCESS) AS subquery
WHERE changes > 2 
OR automated_cases_per_vendor / total_cases_per_vendor >= 0.25
OR ( "Clearing transaction code" IS NOT NULL
	    AND "Clearing transaction code" != 'F110' )
UNION ALL           

--Late changes--
SELECT
'Late changes' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
		WHERE (EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
		LIKE 'Create invoice%'
		~> 'Invoicing party changed'
	)) 
		--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'	
		OR (EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
		LIKE 'Create invoice%'
		~> 'Quantity changed'
	))
) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL

------------
--'Other'---
------------
SELECT 
"Category" AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
"Amount converted",
CASE
--'Immediate payment terms'
WHEN "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0 THEN 'RCA'
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
WHEN "Net due date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
        AND ("Cash discount percentage 1" = 0
		OR "Cash discount percentage 1" IS NULL) THEN 'RCA'
--'Posted as overdue'
WHEN "Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date" THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice approval via other means'
WHEN    "Release date" > "Net due date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
WHEN "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Manual interactions'
WHEN (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
WHEN ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
		WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
		COUNT(1) * 100) > 20 THEN 'RCA'
--'Manual payment run'
WHEN "Clearing transaction code" IS NOT NULL
	  AND "Clearing transaction code" != 'F110' THEN 'RCA'
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
ELSE 'Other' END AS "Category"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
) as sub1
WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
) as sub2
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Financial impact of late payment
children.description: Calculating the impact of late payments assuming penalty interest for late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT  SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Clearing date" > "Net due date"
		AND "Clearing date" - "Net due date" <= DURATION '7days')
        )
        * DURATION_TO_DAYS(AVG("Clearing date" - "Net due date") FILTER (
        WHERE ("Clearing date" > "Net due date" AND "Clearing date" - "Net due date" <= DURATION '7days')))
		* 0.1 / 365 AS "Financial impact"
	FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Prioritizing company codes and vendors to avoid late payments

blocks.text: Company codes which show a high amount of cases with late payments might need special attention. You might also want to take a look at vendors who are often paid late.Based on that, you can filter the following analyses for root causes for late payments based on the company codes respectively vendors which are mostly affected by late payments.

children.name: Detect patterns and financial impact of late payments

blocks.text: The following analysis helps you to identify the combination of company codes and vendors mostly affected by late payments. It also provides input on the affected amount and whether the payment run was used for clearing. In case the payment run was used for clearing, but the clearing is still late, the following root cause analyses might help to detect the reason for late payments such as blocking, immediate payment terms etc.

children.name: Root cause analysis for late payments

blocks.text: Assuming that you have an issue with late payments, it's essential to detect root causes for late payments in order to avoid late payments moving forward.
The following categories are provided in order to provide insights into root causes for late payments:

Invoice posted or payment block released after net due date: Invoices have been posted or unblocked only after net due date. That's why it was not possible to pay them on time. Learn more about how they have been unblocked and how the blocking process can be improved using the following analyses.

Disadvantageous payment conditions: If invoices are due very soon or even immediately after you have received them, chances are high you will pay late. Understand how the usage of payment conditions impact your late payment rate.

High manual effort: In case the degree of automation throughout the invoice to pay process is low and additional manual changes are performed throughout the process, this can delay the process including the payment.
Late changes: Subsequent changes in the supplier invoice, for example when it comes to the invoice quantity, might delay the clearing since essential information relevant for clearing is changed.
Others - cases that were paid after the net due date but do not fall into any of the defined root cause categories.
Be aware that the several potential root causes might apply to the same invoice document.
More detailed insights into each root cause category are provided in the following analyses.

children.name: Invoice posted or payment block released after net due date

blocks.text: Posted after net due date: Invoice is posted after the net due date has already passed. Reasons for this might be either immediate/unfavorable payment terms or long lead times until the invoice is posted, which could be due to approval steps, for example.

Release for payment due to invoice verification after net due date: Price and/or quantity changes might cause the invoice to be blocked for payment by invoice verification. In this case, late payments might be justifiable due to the fact that the vendor did not deliver the expected goods receipt or charged the agreed price, for example. This root cause is only relevant for invoices created with reference to a purchase order.

Release invoice for payment via finance workflow/transaction after net due date: Release is performed in Finance only but after net due date. This leads to late payments which might be justified - depending on the reason for blocking.
Release invoice via other means after net due date: Release is performed after net due date, but neither via invoice verification not Finance workflow.

Please consider that blocking invoices for payment might be justified in many cases, for example in case of no/partial goods receipt or quality issues. However, identifying frequent blocking due to these reasons also helps you the supplier reliability. Moreover, you should make sure to unblock invoices as soon as the blocking reason is clarified or obsolete in order to not further delay payments without a justified reasons.. For logistics invoices, this can be ensured by using the automatic unblocking functionality executed via transaction code MRBR.

children.name: Disadvantageous payment conditions

blocks.text: Immediate payment terms: Having to pay immediately often results in late payments since immediate payments would only be possible if the payment run runs on the same day and the invoice is not blocked.

Unfavorable payment terms: Similar to immediate payment terms, unfavorable payment terms can cause late payments. If payment is due in less than 15 days after the invoice has been issued, the net due date might be easily missed, for example due to approval workflows or in case the payment run is not run on a daily basis.

Payment conditions not correctly defined: Payment terms deviate between purchase order and financial document , where better payment terms in purchase orders compared to financial document  set. You might need time to clarify which payment term is the right one or might be surprised by less favorable payment terms in the invoice resulting in late payments.
In order to understand how to avoid the three  issues above, please refer to the dashboard "Optimize Payment Term Usage".

children.name: High manual effort

blocks.text: Frequent manual interactions: If the invoice document is frequently changed manually, this can delay the time till payment and thus be a potential root cause for late payments. Frequently is defined as more than two times in this analysis. To learn which changes are performed manually and what their root causes are, please refer to the dashboard "Avoid operational inefficiencies".
Low automation of invoice postings: The automation rate of the vendor is lower than 25% (cases where user type (entered by) is 'A')
Manual payment: If the clearing transaction code is not F110 or empty, it can be assumed that the clearing is not performed automatically, which can further delay the payment process.

children.name: Late changes

blocks.text: Supplier changed after invoice posting: The supplier has been changed after the invoice has been posted. This can delay the payment and thus be a reason for late payment since the invoice might have to be canceled and reposted.

Quantity changes after invoice posting: The quantity has been changed after the invoice has been posted. Such late changes can cause late payments due to additional processing steps and clarification between the buyer and your Finance team.

children.name: Root cause analysis: Invoice posted or payment block released after net due date

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Posted after net due date'
SELECT
'Posted after net due date' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Late invoice approval via other means'
SELECT
'Late invoice approval via other means' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Release date" > "Net due date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL   
--'Late invoice verification'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date")
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL       
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification via FI workflow or FI transaction' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date")
		AS "Amount affected"
        FROM THIS_PROCESS        
) as sub1
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Root cause analysis: Disadvantageous payment conditions

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Immediate payment terms'
SELECT
'Immediate payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
SELECT
'Unfavorable payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
	    WHERE ("Cash discount days 1") < 
    	  ("PO payment term cash discount days 1") OR 
          ("Cash discount days 2") < 
    	  ("PO payment term cash discount days 2") OR 
          ("Net payment terms period") <
          ("PO payment term Net payment terms period")
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS     
UNION ALL        
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
SELECT
'Payment condition not correctly defined' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
        FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub1
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Root cause analysis: High manual effort

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Manual interactions'
SELECT
'Manual interactions' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 )
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
SELECT
"RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT
'Low automation of invoice postings' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
"Amount converted",
COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') OVER (PARTITION BY Vendor) AS automated_cases_per_vendor,
COUNT(1) OVER (PARTITION BY Vendor) AS total_cases_per_vendor
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE automated_cases_per_vendor / total_cases_per_vendor >= 0.25
UNION ALL
--'Manual payment'--
SELECT
'Manual payment' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE ( "Clearing transaction code" IS NOT NULL
	    AND "Clearing transaction code" != 'F110' ) ) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
     
) as sub1
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Root cause analysis: Late changes

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(      
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Supplier changed after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL  
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Quantity Changes after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub1
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date"

children.name: Root cause analysis for late payments

dataSource.query:
SELECT  "RCA category",
		CASE
    		WHEN "Process Flow" = 'KPPURCH460' THEN 'With Purchase Order'
        	ELSE 'W/o Purchase Order'
    	END AS "Process Variant",
        SUM("Amount affected") AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(  
--'Immediate payment terms'
SELECT
'Immediate payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
        OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
SELECT
'Unfavorable payment terms' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
	    WHERE "Net due date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
        AND ("Cash discount percentage 1" = 0
        OR "Cash discount percentage 1" IS NULL)
		AND "Cash discount days 1" > 0
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Posted as overdue'
SELECT
'Posted as overdue' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date") AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Late invoice approval'
SELECT
'Late invoice approval' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Release date" > "Net due date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
SELECT
'Payment condition not correctly defined' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL         
--'Late goods receipt'
SELECT
'Late goods receipt' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Payment block" = 'R' 
        AND "Release date" > "Net due date"
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL         
--'Late invoice verification'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date")
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL       
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
SELECT
'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date")
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL
--'Manual interactions'
SELECT
'Manual interactions' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 )
		AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL        
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
SELECT
'Low automation of invoice postings' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
		WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
		COUNT(1) * 100) > 20 ) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL           
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Supplier changed after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS        
UNION ALL  
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
SELECT
'Quantity Changes after invoice posting' AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
)) AS "Amount affected"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
UNION ALL
------------
--'Other'---
------------
SELECT 
"Category" AS "RCA category",
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
SUM("Amount converted") FILTER (
		WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
		) AS "Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT
"Clearing date",
"Net due date",
"Process Flow",
"Amount converted",
CASE
--'Immediate payment terms'
WHEN "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0 THEN 'RCA'
--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
WHEN "Net due date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
        AND ("Cash discount percentage 1" = 0
		OR "Cash discount percentage 1" IS NULL) THEN 'RCA'
--'Posted as overdue'
WHEN "Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date" THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice approval'
WHEN    "Release date" > "Net due date"
		AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
		IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
WHEN "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL THEN 'RCA'
--'Late goods receipt'
WHEN "Payment block" = 'R' 
        AND "Release date" > "Net due date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Late invoice verification via finance workflow or FI transaction'
WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date"
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Manual interactions'
WHEN (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 
		THEN 'RCA'
--'Low automation of invoice postings'
WHEN ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
		WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
		COUNT(1) * 100) > 20 THEN 'RCA'
--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Invoicing party changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
LIKE 'Create invoice%'
~> 'Quantity changed'
) THEN 'RCA'
ELSE 'Other' END AS "Category"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
) as sub1
WHERE "Category" = 'Other'
) as sub2
WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date" 
ORDER BY 3 DESC

children.name: Impact of late payments: Company code/vendor combinations more than 10 cases affected ordered by late payment rate

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Clearing date" AS "Clearing month",
	"Company code",
	"Vendor",
	"Payment run indicator",
	"# Cases",
	"Invoice amount",
	"Late payment rate",
	"Cases affected",
	"Amount affected"
FROM
(
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('month', "Clearing date") AS "Clearing date",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id) AS "# Cases",
	SUM("Amount converted") AS "Invoice amount",
	COUNT(DISTINCT case_id)  FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date") AS "Cases affected",
	SUM("Amount converted" )  FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date") AS "Amount affected",
	SUM("Amount converted") FILTER
			(WHERE "Clearing date" > "Net due date")
    	/ SUM("Amount converted") * 100 AS "Late payment rate",
	"Company code",
    "Vendor",
    CASE 
	WHEN "Clearing transaction code" IS NULL
	OR "Clearing transaction code" = 'F110' 
    THEN '✅' ELSE '⛔'
	END AS "Payment run indicator"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
) as sub
WHERE "Cases affected" > 10
ORDER BY 7 DESC, 9 DESC

children.name: Detailed root cause analyses for late payments

blocks.text: Based on the previous analysis, you might have learnt that your late payment rate, coming with negative consequences such as damaging supplier relationships and/or penalty interest, have been root causes such as manual effort or disadvantageous payment conditions. In order to drill down further into the different root causes and derive measures to avoid those moving forward, you can use the following analyses which provide more detailed insights into each root cause category.

children.name: 04. Details
On-time performance by cases

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Process flow text",
    "case_id",
    "Company code",
	"Purchasing organization",
	"Vendor",
	"Purchasing document",
    "Invoice document number",
    "Fiscal year",
    "Accounting document number",
    "Accounting document fiscal year",
    "Amount converted",
	CASE 
	 	WHEN "Clearing date" > "Net due date"
	THEN 'Late payment'
		WHEN "Clearing date" < ("Net due date"  -  DURATION '3days')
		  AND ("Cash discount amount" = 0 OR "Cash discount amount" IS NULL)
	THEN 'Early payment'
	ELSE 'On-time payment'
    END AS "Clearing behaviour",
    ---RCA---
	--'Immediate payment terms'
	CASE WHEN "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
		 OR "Cash discount days 1" = 0 THEN 'X' END AS "Immediate payment terms",
	--'Unfavorable payment terms'        
	CASE WHEN "Net due date" - "Baseline date" <  DURATION '15days'
	        AND ("Cash discount percentage 1" = 0
			OR "Cash discount percentage 1" IS NULL) THEN 'X' END AS "Unfavorable payment terms",
	--'Posted as overdue'
	CASE WHEN "Accounting document entry date" > "Net due date" THEN 'X' END AS "Posted as overdue",
	--'Late invoice approval via other means'
	CASE WHEN "Release date" > "Net due date"
			AND (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name 
			IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow','Release payment block via invoice verification'))) IS NULL THEN 'X' END AS "Late invoice approval via other means",
	--'Payment condition not correctly defined'
	CASE WHEN "PO payment terms" <> "FI payment terms"
	        AND "Clearing document" IS NOT NULL
	        AND "Invoice reversal document" IS NULL THEN 'X' END AS "Payment condition not correctly defined",
	--'Late invoice verification'
	CASE WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name = 'Release payment block via invoice verification')) > "Net due date"
			THEN 'X' END AS "Late invoice verification",
	--'Late invoice verification via FI workflow or FI transaction'
	CASE WHEN (SELECT LAST (end_time) FILTER (WHERE event_name IN ('Release payment block via finance transaction', 'Release payment block via finance workflow'))) > "Net due date"
			THEN 'X' END AS "Late invoice verification via FI workflow or FI transaction",
	--'Manual interactions'
	CASE WHEN (SELECT COUNT (1) FILTER (WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%change%' 
	  		AND "Change Document" IS NOT NULL )) > 2 
			THEN 'X' END AS "Manual interactions",
	--'Low automation of invoice postings'
	CASE WHEN ( SELECT COUNT(1) FILTER (
			WHERE "User type (entered by)" = 'A') / 
			COUNT(1) * 100) > 20  THEN 'X' END AS "Low automation of invoice postings",
	--'Manual payment'
	CASE WHEN "Clearing transaction code" IS NOT NULL
		  AND "Clearing transaction code" != 'F110'  THEN 'X' END AS "Manual payment",
	--'Supplier changed after invoice posting'
	CASE WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
	LIKE 'Create invoice%'
	~> 'Invoicing party changed'
	)  THEN 'X' END AS "Supplier changed after invoice posting",
	--'Quantity Changes after invoice posting'
	CASE WHEN EVENT_NAME MATCHES (
	LIKE 'Create invoice%'
	~> 'Quantity changed'
	)  THEN 'X' END AS "Quantity Changes after invoice posting",
    "Accounting document entry date",
	"FI payment terms",
	"FI payment term description",
	CASE 
    	WHEN "Cash discount days 1" = 0 OR "Cash discount days 1" IS NULL
    	THEN 'Immediate payment terms'
    	WHEN "Net due date" - "Baseline date" > DURATION '0days' 
    		AND "Net due date" - "Baseline date" < DURATION '15days'
    		AND "Cash discount percentage 1" IS NOT NULL
			AND "Cash discount percentage 1" != 0
    	THEN 'Unfavorable payment terms'
    	ELSE 'Favorable payment terms'
        END AS "Payment terms category",
	CASE 
    	WHEN "FI payment term cash discount days 1" = 0 OR "FI payment term cash discount days 1" IS NULL
    	THEN 'Immediate'
        WHEN "FI payment term cash discount percentage 1" IS NOT NULL
			AND "FI payment term cash discount percentage 1" != 0 AND
    CASE 
		WHEN "FI payment term net payment terms period" > 0 
		THEN "FI payment term net payment terms period"
		WHEN "FI payment term net payment terms period" = 0 AND "FI payment term cash discount days 2" > 0
		THEN "FI payment term cash discount days 2"
	ELSE "FI payment term cash discount days 2"
	END < 15 
    THEN 'Unfavorable'
    ELSE 'Favorable'
    END AS "FI payment terms",
	CASE 
    	WHEN "PO payment term cash discount days 1" = 0 OR "FI payment term cash discount days 1" IS NULL
    	THEN 'Immediate'
        WHEN "PO payment term cash discount percentage 1" IS NOT NULL
			AND "PO payment term cash discount percentage 1" != 0 AND
        CASE 
			WHEN "PO payment term net payment terms period" > 0 
			THEN "PO payment term net payment terms period"
			WHEN "PO payment term net payment terms period" = 0 AND "PO payment term cash discount days 2" > 0
			THEN "PO payment term cash discount days 2"
		ELSE "PO payment term cash discount days 2"
		END < 15 
    		THEN 'Unfavorable'
       ELSE 'Favorable'
       END AS "PO payment terms",
	"PO payment terms",
	"FI payment terms","Cash discount amount",
    "Cash discount days 1",
    "Cash discount days 2",
    "Net payment terms period",
    "Cash discount percentage 1",
    "Cash discount percentage 2"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
